reviews.text: Crisp white bedlinen, piping hot water for baths and showers, fabulous food ( the toasted soda bread and wonderful raspberry jam in particular at breakfast time ) , welcoming down to earth staff for whom nothing is too much trouble. Ample parking, superb guiness, lovely period rooms with four poster beds in several. Hotel has just been taken over recently but have kept the same brilliant staff. Could do with getting a handyman in to check lots of little fix it jobs around like: squeaky doors, wonky wall pictures, lose shower handles but all of these things are minor and can be sorted quickly no problem. What you get here, is home from home comfort, with big squashy leather chairs in the reading room, shiny oak polished floors and immaculately cleaned and ironed white Irish linen table cloths. My only recommendation is that they update their written hotel guest information to include other local restaurants and cafe's, local exercise facilities for example at Clonmel Swimming Pool and fun places locally to take children like the wonderful river side play park on the road out to Waterford / the new ish bowling alley on the outskirts of town/the local cinema etc.

reviews.text: I also stayed here for a wedding I attended last year. Our whole experience was extremely positive. The staff at the front desk were super efficient and very friendly. Our room was just beautiful; the four-poster bed was a treat! I have to say that the food was also excellent. We enjoyed a stroll in the picturesque grounds & had a few drinks in the little quaint bar. Truly a memorable experience.
reviews.title: Truly a memorable experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We attended a wedding here and it is just such a beautiful house. The four poster bed and the unique decoration in every room makes it so special. Everywhere you look there are more little quirky bits n pieces. The reception room was fantastic and very airy on such a hot day. The staff and breakfast were great, as were the grounds of the hotel. It is located within walking distance of the river and town centre and I would gladly go back again.
reviews.title: beautiful house
beautiful country house
reviews.text: Having recently stayed overnight in Raheen House at a wedding I cannot say enough about it. The rooms were beautifully furnished with antiques and the four poster bed was enormous. As the wedding ceremony itself was held in the hotel we didnt have to leave once we checked in and we thoroughly relaxed. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The wedding breakfast and breakfast the next morning were excellent. Fellas if you looking for somewhere special to take the lady in your life for a weekend you cant go wrong with here.Mountains,shopping and romance you have it all!
